Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Home_Create .NET apps faster with NuGet_Text Spacing: After applying text spacing 'Versions' text is not visible properly." (#8988) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468954

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. "Home" page will get open.
3. Apply text spacing and observe that 'Versions' text is visible properly or not.

After applying text spacing 'Versions' text is not visible properly.

Similar issue is observed for "Packages" text also.

### Expected Behavior

After applying text spacing all the content should be clearly visible.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Home_Create .NET apps faster with NuGet_ColorContrast :The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background is 2.81:1 which less than 3:1." (#8987) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468969

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL:https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer/
2. Tab to the tap navigation
3. Run the Accessibility insights for web 
4. Check the color contrast for the selected items 

The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background is 2.81:1 which less than 3:1.

Similar issue is observed in the scenario given below:
- Account_ForgotPassword - focus boundary for 'Send' button.

### Expected Behavior

The color contrast ratio of 'search' sign with respect to it's background must be equal to or greater than 3:1.

Similar issue is observed in through out the application

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer_ColorContrast :The color contrast ratio of the focus on the item in the top navigation is 2.061:1 which less than 3:1" (#8986) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468939

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer/
2. Tab to the tap navigation
3. Run the Accessibility insights for web 
4. Check the color contrast for the selected items 

The color contrast ratio of the focus on the top selected item in the navigation is 2.061:1 which less than 3:1

Similar issue is observed in throughout the application for all the items in the navigation bar and controls that have a black focus outline with blue background

### Expected Behavior

The color contrast ratio for the focus must be 3:1 or greater

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Download counters not updating for pre-release packages?" (#8979) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

## TL/DR

It seems to me that the download counter is not working for versions of packages that are marked as pre-release.

The total download for a package that has pre-release versions but also "normal" versions seems to work fine, even though each pre-release version is stuck at 0 (zero).

Please note that the usual delay of 24/48h for the stats to be updated is already passed, since we are at around 6 days.
Also, in these 6 days the other downloads seem to have been updated just fine: I'm talking about my **global** downloads, the downloads for each **package as a whole**, and the downloads for each **package version** that is NOT a pre-release version.


## The setup

Up until last week I had 3 packages on nuget.org , all of them had some versions released in the last year, and none of those versions were pre-release (per semantic versioning).

All was fine.

Last week (Jan 27th to be precise) I uploaded 2 completely new packages (both with a pre-release version) and 3 new versions (again, all pre-release) of the 3 existing packages.
So all of these were in "alpha1" version.
Then about 3 days after that i pushed another pre-release version ("alpha2") for all of the 5 packages.

You can see all 5 of them [here](https://www.nuget.org/profiles/jodydonetti) (screenshot taken 2022-02-02):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152252639-1d57cb56-60c9-4d44-8e71-c5548df49e88.png)

(Now don't be fooled by the 0.1.9 you can see as the "Latest version" for the first 3 packages, since what is shown is the latest non-pre-release version, as I'm sure you know)

So, all these packages have an actual last version that is pre-release (currently "alpha2").


## The Problem

The problem is that since then, the download counters for each pre-releae version remained stuck at 0 (zero), even though me and other people already downloaded them.

See screenshots below for some evidence.

### Repro Steps

Hypothetically:
- upload a new pre-release version of an existing package OR upload a completely new package (with a pre-release version)
- make some downloads
- wait a couple of days
- download stats will not increase

### Expected Behavior

Download stats SHOULD increase.

### Screenshots

## New package

Downloads for one of the new packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache.Backplane.StackExchangeRedis/0.1.0-alpha2)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152254941-84a73ae1-4146-495c-8c6a-8de0828ef696.png)

## Existing package

Downloads for one of the existing packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache/0.1.9)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152255046-23f4fcda-e4cc-4c13-957e-a64710c3129f.png)

Note that as, I said above, in the last 6 days the downloads for the v0.1.9 kept increasing.

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package source mapping should check for duplicate node keys" (#11573) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If you following setup then you'll get `dotnet` source not considered for `Microsoft.Somepackage` error during restore,
problem is there 2 nodes with same `dotnet` key so last one overwrites the first one. We need to detect this and warn customer about it before try to restore.

Bad config:
```
  <packageSourceMapping>
    <packageSource key="dotnet">
      <package pattern="Microsoft.*" />
    </packageSource>     
    <packageSource key="dotnet">
      <package pattern="System.Securiry*" />
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```


Good config:
```
  <packageSourceMapping>
    <packageSource key="dotnet">
      <package pattern="Microsoft.*" />
      <package pattern="System.Securiry*" />
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```
